channel.title: God-Spotting
channel.description: Have you ever had an amazing conversation with one of the everyday extraordinary people you know and wish you could have captured it to share it with someone else? Well, Pastor Jodi Haier is having and capturing these conversations. While focusing on the five components of church, the listeners gets to hear how God continues to show up and the ripples that are caused by this movement.
channel.itunes:subtitle: No one has ever seen God; but if we love one another, God lives in us and his love is made complete in us." (1 John 4:12)
channel.itunes:author: Joanne Haier
channel.itunes:summary: Have you ever had an amazing conversation with one of the everyday extraordinary people you know and wish you could have captured it to share it with someone else? Well, Pastor Jodi Haier is having and capturing these conversations. While focusing on the five components of church, the listeners gets to hear how God continues to show up and the ripples that are caused by this movement.

item.title: GS 15 A Tribute to Barb Fisk
item.description: This podcast is a shorter one but a much deeper one for many reasons. It covers all 5 components of church but (I hope) honors my friend. It is not a bummer but a tribute. When you are finished please listen to http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9mDhpQSzEfM&feature=related Instead of a pictre of Barb, I chose a laughing Jesus because that is the image she chose to be her legacy. With Barb you always knew that God had a sense of humor. enjoy!
item.dc:creator: Joanne Haier

item.title: GS 14 Mission featuring Jessica Collis
item.description: Before listening to this podcast go listen to at least one of these songs, Mountaintop (The City Harmonic) Hands & Feet (Audio Adrenaline)I can only imagine (MercyMe) Love is here (Tenth Avenue North) Then get out your passports as we travel the world and explore our backyard, from the comfort of a kitchen table. Prepare to be CHALLENGED!
item.dc:creator: Joanne Haier
item.itunes:summary: Before listening to this podcast go listen to at least one of these songs, Mountaintop (The City Harmonic) Hands & Feet (Audio Adrenaline)I can only imagine (MercyMe) Love is here (Tenth Avenue North) Then get out your passports as we travel the world and explore our backyard, from the comfort of a kitchen table. Prepare to be CHALLENGED!

item.title: Dictionary Minicast Holy featuring Cathy Chapman and Valerie Schmadel
item.description: God-spotting is all about seeing God. Sometimes language helps build a bridge other times it stands in the way. These mini-casts are a way to help us use language from a new perspective. Join Pastor Jodi around the table with Cathy and Val as we deconstruct "holy." Use the comment feature to add your favorite songs that feature the word "holy."
item.dc:creator: Joanne Haier
item.itunes:summary: God-spotting is all about seeing God. Sometimes language helps build a bridge other times it stands in the way. These mini-casts are a way to help us use language from a new perspective. Join Pastor Jodi around the table with Cathy and Val as we deconstruct "holy." Use the comment feature to add your favorite songs that feature the word "holy."

item.title: GS 13 Amalgm featuring Russ Riddell
item.description: This podcast starts with Big Daddy Weave's Let it Rise to set the tone. Then my living room couch is ON FIRE! My new mike makes the sound so much better. Russ Riddell tells about his time in Afghanistan and how he used the 5 components to gain and keep perspective. You might want to crck open your bible as we jump in.
item.dc:creator: Joanne Haier

item.title: GS 12 Amalgm Brian Fellows
item.description: All the components with no waiting. I had a blast with Pastor, friend, peer, mentor, elder and brother Brian Fellows. This podcast has it all: laughs puns scripture and even ends with a song. One link is to our word of the day: pericope (said "pair ick a pee") and the other is to the featured song. Get comfy this is a long one but definitely worth the commitment. enjoy! http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/pericope and http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1XDpRE9s08c

item.title: Gs 11 Evangelism with Sarah Schmidt Lee
item.description: I can't wait to spend time with her and the kids again! I would love to have professional sound but regardless of my microphone and mistakes, Pastor Sarah is truly a gem. Her poise and grace and hope just sing throughout this podcast. I would find Jesus Freak the original video to listen to before the podcast. Also she mentions a website for bible studies from Baylor University http://www.baylor.edu/christianethics/index.php?id=41985 She also mentions a prayer Breakfast in ROme on the national Day of Prayer
item.dc:creator: Joanne Haier

item.title: GS 10 Ministry with Steve Chapman
item.description: INCREDIBLE! INFECTIOUS (in a good way) I got reinspired just editing this episode. Oh, you should find the song MOVE from MercyMe on Youtube and listen to it before this podcast, although I'm not sure but Mercy Me may have been talking about Steve when they wrote the Generous Mr. LoveWell. I think this is the episode that people begin to talk back.

item.title: GS 9 Worship with Ashley Stanton
item.description: the sound quality is uneven. but the conversation is profound. enjoy the music and the dance even though you can't see us dancing. Remember eligible bachelors, there is a rigorous screening process for all those young men who would like to woo the lovely Ms. Ashley. But tht's not what this podcast is about...

item.title: GS8 Fellowship with Chris Soper
item.description: Superman or Soper-man you decide. This conversation was a joy and a blessing to record. Enjoy! I edited with a bowl of Maple-Walnut. Choose your own flavor and join us!
item.dc:creator: Joanne Haier
item.itunes:summary: Superman or Soper-man you decide. This conversation was a joy and a blessing to record. Enjoy! I edited with a bowl of Maple-Walnut. Choose your own flavor and join us!

item.title: GS 7 Amalgm with the Queen of Ish
item.description: This one was trouble right from the beginning. It is the first mix episode that discusses all five areas: Worship, Fellowship, Discipleship, Evangelism, Mission/Ministry. I hope this blesses you.
item.dc:creator: Joanne Haier
item.itunes:summary: This one was trouble right from the beginning. It is the first mix episode that discusses all five areas: Worship, Fellowship, Discipleship, Evangelism, Mission/Ministry. I hope this blesses you.

item.title: GS 6 Discipleship with Bronwen VanNamee
item.description: Have you ever treated yourself to your favorite ice cream, or a spa day, or a mani-/pedi- , tickets to your favorite team, a day off or a day away? Then you know how good it feels. Please treat yourself and listen to this "round the table conversation." It makes me smile knowing what this one will give you.

item.title: GS 5 Discipleship with Rev. Alan Howe
item.description: In his office at Rome First United Methodist church we discuss discipleship, disciplines, music and Uganda. A large area to cover in just over an hour. Here is the link to the Chris Tomlin song mentioned in this podcast: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x8sw-g6P544, the scripture is Hebrews 12:1-13. Enjoy! (possibly with a Chicken Cordon Bleu Pizza from Luigi's)
item.dc:creator: Joanne Haier

item.title: GS4: Worship with Barbara Bruce
item.description: people are sunshine regardless of the weather. Forget about sunglsses or sunscreen, and just bask in this amazing delightful woman.
item.dc:creator: Joanne Haier
item.itunes:summary: people are sunshine regardless of the weather. Forget about sunglsses or sunscreen, and just bask in this amazing delightful woman.

item.title: GS3: Evangelism with Marguerite Edwards
item.description: At the same kitchen table, but a different day. Before listening check out http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g-IxhvZUOUs you'll find the Peter Furler song that is mentioned. This episode has spots of loudness due to laughter and a mike that hates "p"s. Enjoy!
